flow.descriptionCdata:
5223e750-3b71-4856-bef8-617ca3015ab6.099e6d4e-bae9-4045-8577-a6052a2ebcde.description=
Start a Run Script process using the given parameters on specified list of target servers (Not supported for SA 6.x).

Inputs\:
coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core.
corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on.
coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS.
coreVersion - The core version.
coreUsername - The username for host.
corePassword - The password for host.
scriptToRun - Name of the script to execute.
scriptToRunID - ID of the script to execute.
args - Arguments to pass to the script.
scriptTimeout - Script timeout in seconds.
targetHosts - The hosts to execute the script on. Should be a ',' separated list of server hostnames (full or partial match, depending on the value of 'targetHostSerachOperator').
targetHostSerachOperator - The value of the search operator used when searching for 'targetHosts'. If the value is 'CONTAINS', then partial hostname match will be performed; if the value is 'EQUAL_TO', then exact hostname match will be performed. The default value is set to 'CONTAINS'.
targetHostIds - The hosts to execute the script on. Should be a ',' separated list of server ids. If this input is provided then 'targetHosts' is ignored.
targetUser - Username to execute the script as.
targetPassword - Password for the username specified.
targetDomain - Windows domain name (if required).
ticketId - TicketId to associate with job.
notificationFailureOwner - Sets the email address of the owner of this job when the job fails.
notificationSuccessOwner - Sets the email address of the owner of this job when the job succeeds.
notificationFailureRecipients - A comma delimited list of the email addresses to notify when this job fails.
notificationSuccessRecipients - A comma delimited list of the email addresses to notify when this job succeeds.
scriptTailOutputSize - Size of the output to retain in bytes (can not exceed 10KB).

Responses\:
success - retrieved successfully
failure - failed to retrieve data

Returns\:
id - The unique ID of this object.
description - The description of this object.
blockedReason - The reason why this job is blocked.
cancelledReason - The reason why this job is canceled.
endDate - The date at which this job will cease to run.
notificationFailureOwner - The user who will own this job if it fails.
notificationSuccessOwner - The user who will own this job if it completes.
notificationFailureRecipients - A ; delimited list of users who will receive notification if this job fails.
notificationSuccessRecipients - A ; delimited list of users who will receive notification if this job completes.
serverName - The name of the server associated with this job.
serverId - The id of the server associated with this job.
staleDate - The date after which this job is considered stale.
startDate - The date where this job started.
status - This object's status.
username - This object's user name.
userTag - This object's unique user tag.
5223e750-3b71-4856-bef8-617ca3015ab6.7e27e66b-72c5-4c4c-b9c7-379ffb515d78.description=
This operation waits for the number of seconds specified in the "seconds" input.

Inputs\:
    seconds - The number of seconds to wait.

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the "completed sleep" message if the operation completed successfully and an error message otherwise. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
5223e750-3b71-4856-bef8-617ca3015ab6.96939949-88b0-4b56-8f55-9ab6c88859b5.description=Run communication test on the given SA server or device group. This operation is supported from SA version 9.1 (sas91). Inputs\: coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core. corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on. coreProtocol - The protocol to connect to your SAS core with. Either HTTP or HTTPS. coreUsername - The username for host. corePassword - The password for host. coreVersion - The version of SAS to use. attachableName - The names of either the servers, or the device groups, separated by 'separator'. attachableID - The ids of either the servers, or the device groups, separated by 'separator'. If provided, the 'attachableName' will be ignored. attachableType - The type of the attachable items. Can be one of the following values\: SERVER or DEVICE_GROUP. timeout - Timeout in milliseconds, to wait for the job to finish. Default value is 0. separator - The separator used for separating the inputs. The default value for the separator is comma (,). Responses\: success - retrieved successfully failure - failed to retrieve data Returns\: returnResult - The id of the job created. 5223e750-3b71-4856-bef8-617ca3015ab6.9adc4e51-7139-41d7-88ed-1b939833ba1d.prompt=To Match\: 5223e750-3b71-4856-bef8-617ca3015ab6.bb274152-8427-4503-ab9a-0d19b8b06579.description=
This operation checks whether a string matches another string, using a specific matching rule. The "toMatch" input is the string that is checked for matching the "matchTo" expression. 

Inputs\:
    matchType - The type of match to perform.
Valid values\: Exact Match, Contains, Contains Once, Does Not Contain, Match All Words, Match No Words, Regex
Default value\: Exact Match
    toMatch - The string that is checked for matching.
    matchTo - The string to match against.
Example\: If "matchType" is “RegEx”, the "matchTo" input is a regular expression such as\: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. 
    ignoreCase - Specifies whether to ignore case when matching or not.
Valid values\: False, True
Default value\: False

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains the string "Matches" if the "toMatch" string matches the "matchTo" string. Otherwise, it contains the string "Does Not Match".  

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed as stated in the description.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.
5223e750-3b71-4856-bef8-617ca3015ab6.e6d7b9d2-b358-492b-9ac7-f916275fbaf3.description=
Start a Run Script process using the given parameters on specified list of target servers (Not supported for SA 6.x).

Inputs\:
coreHost - The DNS name or IP Address of your SAS core.
corePort - The port to Connect to your SAS core on.

targetHostIds - The hosts to execute the script on. Should be a ',' separated list of server ids. If this input is provided then 'targetHosts' is ignored.
targetUser - Username to execute the script as.

cancelledReason - The reason why this job is canceled.
endDate - The date at which this job will cease to run.
notificationFailureOwner - The user who will own this job if it fails.
notificationSuccessOwner - The user who will own this job if it completes.
notificationFailureRecipients - A ; delimited list of users who will receive notification if this job fails.
notificationSuccessRecipients - A ; delimited list of users who will receive notification if this job completes.
serverName - The name of the server associated with this job.
serverId - The id of the server associated with this job.
staleDate - The date after which this job is considered stale.
startDate - The date where this job started.
status - This object's status.
username - This object's user name.
userTag - This object's unique user tag.
flow.name: apacheWorkflows
